text:
Mohamed Sayah (Arabic: محمد الصيّاح‎; 31 December 1933 – 15 March 2018) was a Tunisian politician. He held a number of ministerial roles in the 1960s, 1970s, and 1980s. Sayah held many ministerial portfolios under President Habib Bourguiba. He retired when Zine El Abidine Ben Ali rose to power.
Sayah died on 15 March 2018 in Tunis at the age of 84.
